subsection_content:
To prevent polysinusitis, Ho Van Huu, M.D., M.Sc., notes each person as follows:
Avoid catching colds and or other infections;; Avoid contact with allergens such as pollen, animal hair... or irritants such as cigarette smoke...; Have a healthy diet with fresh vegetables and fruits rich in antioxidants;; Get a flu vaccine every year;; Wash your hands regularly to avoid infection;; Always keep your body warm, especially your ears, nose, and throat;; When suffering from acute flu and rhinitis, patients need to see a doctor to receive appropriate treatment to avoid subsequent polysinusitis;; Patients with allergic rhinitis or patients with diseases accompanying polysinusitis should see a doctor early and have their sinuses checked regularly.
Getting vaccinated against seasonal flu every year is one of the ways to prevent complications that cause sinusitis. Photo: VNVC Vaccination Center
